column4: Hi guys, I am trying to run an application and capture any and all console output generated. I have tried just piping it to a file, and i've tried running it in a shell and piping the output of the shell instance, but neither way has been able to capture any and all command output.. Anyone got any ideas how I can capture everything into a file?
it's most likely being outputted as stderr instead of stdout, you'll need to redirect that as well
sure, how do I do that in a similar style to pipe
